captions.text:
From the creator of your older sister’s
favorite 80’s movies

and the Chris Columbus that didn’t kill
any Indians

comes the Christmas classic that cable channels
have rerun every holiday season for the last
20? God that makes me feel old...

Deck the halls and gather round for a family
film about standing your ground

in one of the most violent kids movies ever
made,

This Christmas, travel to the all-white part
of Chicago

Rejoice in the Christmas spirit as they gang
up on this 8-year-old boy.
"Don't you know how to knock, phlegm-wad?"
"Look what ya did, you little jerk!"

Then stick him in the attic and leave the
country.

Witness years of neglect and abuse take their
toll on this small child,

as he shows all the signs of becoming a sociopath,
like

"I can't seem to find my toothbrush so I'll
pick one up when I go out today."

and trapping two non-violent criminals inside
a sadistic world of torture from which there

But gosh darn if he isn’t just the cutest
little thing.

There’s Marv, who sounds like the narrator
from the Wonder Years.

And Harry, who sounds like Joe Pesci trying
not to curse in a PG movie.
only rob from one block in broad daylight,
wear fingerless gloves during a burglary,
and are irrationally obsessed with one house

"That's the one, Marvin. That's the silver
tuna."

that's really just full of mannequins and
poinsettias.

Seriously, there’s like nothing there worth
stealing here.

So bundle up and relive the early 90’s joy
of

Prepare to have your heartstrings tugged as
Kevin, who’s been Home Alone for 3 days,
is finally reunited with his family

comments.text:
You know what, screw it. I'm going to suggest it despite all the back lash 
I probably will receive.
Honest trailers - My Little pony friendship is magic.

Let the hate messages commence.﻿
